title: Petitions to the Rent Board
description: Petitions may be filed for a variety of reasons, most commonly to have the Rent Board determine the rent. Some of the other common petition filing grounds include: decrease in housing services, unlawful rent increase, failure to repair and maintain, roommate proportional share of the rent, general obligation bond passthrough challenge, utility passthrough challenge, water revenue bond passthrough challenge, violation of the Residential Hotel Visitor Policy, capital improvement passthroughs, operating and maintenance expense increases, extension of time (to perform capital improvement work), comparable rents, intent to withdraw (Ellis), utility passthrough petition and worksheet, Costa-Hawkins determination, Rules and Regulations §1.21, hardship applications, and Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR). Petitions are also accepted on “other” grounds. For more information, please see: https://www.sf.gov/landlord-petitions-and-passthroughs and https://www.sf.gov/tenant-petitions

columns.name: Petition ID
columns.description: Case number assigned to all petitions filed with the Rent Board.

columns.name: Date Filed
columns.description: Date petition filed

columns.name: Priority
columns.description: Check box used by petitions that are required to be expedited

columns.name: Appeal ID
columns.description: Appeal case number assigned to all appeals filed with the Rent Board

columns.name: Filing Party
columns.description: Petition filed by landlord or tenant

columns.name: Prop I Petition
columns.description: Proposition I petition

columns.name: Ground (landlord): Capital Improvement
columns.description: Petition filed for capital improvements

columns.name: Ground (landlord): Comparable Rents
columns.description: Petition filed for comparable rents

columns.name: Ground (landlord): Extension of Time for Capital Improvements
columns.description: Petition filed for extension of time for capital improvments

columns.name: Ground (landlord): Intent to Withdraw (Ellis)
columns.description: Notice of intent to withdraw units from rental market under Ellis filed

columns.name: Ground (landlord): Other
columns.description: Petition filed under other ground

columns.name: Ground (landlord): Operating & Maintenance
columns.description: Petition filed for increased operating and maintenance expenses

columns.name: Ground (landlord): Substantial Rehabilitation
columns.description: Petition filed for substantial rehabilitation

columns.name: Ground (landlord):  Costa-Hawkins
columns.description: A petition filed by a landlord to have the board decide if they are entitled to an increase pursuant to Cost-Hawkins (CC §1954.50 et al)

columns.name: Ground (landlord):  Exemption
columns.description: Petition filed by a landlord to determine exemption from the rent ordinance.

columns.name: Ground (landlord): Rules and Regulations Section 1.21
columns.description: Petition filed by a landlord to determine if an increase pursuant to R&R §6.14 is warranted.

columns.name: Ground (landlord): Rules and Regulations Section 6.14
columns.description: Petition filed by a landlord to determine if an increase pursuant to R&R §6.14 is warranted.

columns.name: Ground (landlord): Rules and Regulations Section 6.15
columns.description: Petition filed by a landlord (master tenant) seeking a determination of the correct proportional rent pursuant to R&R §6.15

columns.name: Ground (landlord): SRO Hotel Vistor Policy Petition
columns.description: Petition filed by a landlord to determine compliance with SRO Hotel Visitor Policy

columns.name: Ground (landlord): Utility Passthrough Petition
columns.description: Petition filed by a landlord to pass through the the cost of utilities by filing a Utility Passthrough Petition

columns.name: Ground (landlord): Owner Move-In Disability Determination
columns.description: Petition filed by a landlord to have the board determine a tenants Owner Move In protected status based on disability.

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Decrease in Housing Services
columns.description: Petition filed for decreased housing services.

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Failure to Repair and Maintain
columns.description: Petition filed for failure to repair and maintain to block a rent increase.

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Passthrough Challenge
columns.description: Petition filed by a tenant to contest a passthrough

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Summary Petition
columns.description: Petition filed by a tenant to contest a rent increase that is clearly in error prior to paying the increase.

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Unlawful Rent Increase
columns.description: Petition filed by a tenant for unlawful rent increase

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Wrongful Eviction Report
columns.description: A report filed by a tenant to allege that an eviction attempt is wrongful

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Section 8 tenancy
columns.description: Petition filed by a tenant if their rent Section 8 unit rent exceeds fair payment standard plus annual allowable increases

columns.name: Ground (tenant): SRO Hotel Vistor Policy Petition
columns.description: Petition filed by a tenant if they believe that the SRO Hotel Vistor Policy is not being followed.

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Rules and Regulations Section 6.15
columns.description: Petition filed by a tenant against a master tenant seeking a determination of the correct proportional rent pursuant to R&R §6.15.

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Other
columns.description: Petition filed by tenant for another gound than those enumerated elsewhere.

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Utility Passhtrough Hardship
columns.description: Petition filed by a tenant to contest a Utility Passhthrough on the basis of financial hardship.

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Water Revenue Bond Passthrough Hardship
columns.description: Petition filed by a tenant to contest a Water Revenue Bond Passhthrough on the basis of financial hardship.

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Capital Improvement Passthrough Hardship Petition
columns.description: Petition filed by a tenant to contest a Capital Improvement Passthrough on the basis of financial hardship.

columns.name: Ground (tenant): Wrongful Severance of Housing Service
columns.description: A report filed by a tenant to allege that a housing service is being illegaly severed

columns.name: Ground: Alternative Dispute Resolution
columns.description: This field indicates a request for Alternative Dispute Resolution was filed.

columns.name: Address
columns.description: Adddress obfuscated to the block or nearest intersection

columns.name: Petition Source Zipcode
columns.description: The zipcode entered into the system of record (as opposed to computed from the latitude and longitude)

columns.name: Supervisor District
columns.description:
District Number - San Francisco Board of Supervisors (1 to 11).

Please note these are automatically assigned based on the latitude and longitude. These will be blank if the automated geocoding was unsuccessful.

columns.name: Neighborhoods - Analysis Boundaries
columns.description:
Analysis neighborhoods corresponding to census boundaries. You can see these boundaries here: https://data.sfgov.org/d/p5b7-5n3h

Please note these are automatically assigned based on the latitude and longitude. These will be blank if the automated geocoding was unsuccessful.

columns.name: shape
columns.description: Location as point in WKT OGC format, e.g., "POINT(-122.3, 37.4)"

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp the data was updated in the source system

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp the data was loaded to the open data portal

queries.Monthly: SELECT date_trunc_ym(date_filed) AS month, count(*) as item_count, filing_party, priority, supervisor_district, neighborhoods_analysis_boundaries, petition_source_zipcode WHERE date_filed >= start_date GROUP BY month, filing_party, priority, supervisor_district, neighborhoods_analysis_boundaries, petition_source_zipcode
queries.Yearly: SELECT date_trunc_y(date_filed) AS year, count(*) as item_count, filing_party, priority, supervisor_district, neighborhoods_analysis_boundaries, petition_source_zipcode WHERE date_filed >= start_date GROUP BY year, filing_party, priority, supervisor_district, neighborhoods_analysis_boundaries, petition_source_zipcode
